messages.text: update the css for a chip to make each background a different, interesting pastel color per preset
Are those css variables built in?
is there a way to reference what index an element is?
Can we make a css class that is like a function? taking an input of a number and returning a color?
I did this, but I don't see it taking effect

We'll need to see and modify the list.js file since that's where the chips are being created. The chips need to have both the `chip` and `pastel-color` classes, and each chip needs its `--n` value set.

Could you share the contents of `paper-cranes/list.js`? Then I can help you modify it to:

1. Add the `pastel-color` class to each chip
2. Set the `--n` custom property for each chip
3. Ensure the colors are being applied correctly

Without seeing list.js, I can't tell if the chips are being created with the right classes and properties. The CSS is set up correctly, but it needs the JavaScript side to provide the input values.
@list.js

I see the issue now. The chips are being created in the `PresetParams` component, but they need both classes. Let's update that component to use both classes and properly set the color: ```javascript:paper-cranes/list.js const PresetParams = ({ preset }) => { const params = new URL(preset).searchParams const presetProps = Array.from(params.entries()).filter(filterPresetProps) return html`
${presetProps.map(([key, value], index) => html`
${key}: ${value}
`)}
` } ``` Key changes: 1. Added the `pastel-color` class alongside `chip` 2. Modified the `--n` calculation to divide by total length to get better color distribution 3. The style attribute now properly sets the CSS custom property This should now show each chip with a unique pastel color based on its position in the list. I divided by the total length to ensure the colors are spread evenly across the available hue range. The colors will now progress smoothly through the pastel spectrum as you move through the chips in each preset group. Each group will start fresh with its own color sequence.
Ok. Make the 'edit' urls look good next to the real urls

Ok. iterate to make this style better. I am using this primarily on mobile, so I want the links easy to click. I want the edit and normal urls to be obviously related together, probably on the same line. But large text, and make it difficult to misclick
The presets do not look related to the parent. Make sure that is obvious
use better colors than gray! I want to make the site fun and colorful and pastel rainbow-y
Hm. The text must be clearly visible from the background. I will be doing this quickly very distracting environments
Uhhh the preset text is illegible now
Make it a dark theme. I'll be in dark environments
Also, I'll be at raves! So theme it lightly appropriately
This needs to be cleaner. No rounded corners
The presets are hard to read. And make the chips subtler
I think the backgrounds should always be dark, and the text light. The contrast between the dark background and the main preset's light background color is irritating
Can you have the main preset urls stick to the top of the page as we scroll?
We need to do something else with the preset headers The blue background and blue text is ugly. Also the padding-bottom of the chip container needs to go away. It looks bad if there are no chips
Different
Actually center the preset text, and make it larger.
Ok do the same for the main visualization link
Add a link icon to the left of every main visualizer url and preset. touching it copies the url
use a link emoji. Make it obvious it was copied
Let's do something to make that button more obvious and the hit target bigger. Increase the contrast. Maybe use a simple svg
Use an svg from somewhere outside our project. This looks awful
It is ok, but the icon is [object Object] once clicked

Ah, we need to properly handle the HTML template literal for the check icon. Let's fix that:

```javascript:paper-cranes/list.js
  const linkIcon = html`<svg viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2">
    <path d="M13.19 8.688a4.5 4.5 0 011.242 7.244l-4.5 4.5a4.5 4.5 0 01-6.364-6.364l1.757-1.757m13.35-.622l1.757-1.757a4.5 4.5 0 00-6.364-6.364l-4.5 4.5a4.5 4.5 0 001.242 7.244" />
  </svg>`

  const copyUrl = (url) => {
    navigator.clipboard.writeText(url)
    const button = event.currentTarget
    button.innerHTML = `<svg viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2">
      <path d="M4.5 12.75l6 6 9-13.5" />
    </svg>`
    setTimeout(() => {
      button.innerHTML = button.innerHTML = `<svg viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2">
        <path d="M13.19 8.688a4.5 4.5 0 011.242 7.244l-4.5 4.5a4.5 4.5 0 01-6.364-6.364l1.757-1.757m13.35-.622l1.757-1.757a4.5 4.5 0 00-6.364-6.364l-4.5 4.5a4.5 4.5 0 001.242 7.244" />
      </svg>`
    }, 1000)
  }
```

Key changes:
1. Removed the `checkIcon` template literal
2. Directly set the SVG HTML string in the button
3. Reset using the same SVG string format

This should properly show both icons now instead of [object Object].
Make the preset links look the same

I notice the preset links are still using the emoji (🔗) while the main links are using the SVG. Let's make them consistent: ```javascript:paper-cranes/list.js return html`
  • ${name} edit
      ${presets.map((preset, index) => html`
    • Preset ${index + 1} edit
      <${PresetParams} preset=${preset} />
      • `)}
    • ` ``` This will make all copy buttons use the same SVG icon and have the same behavior when clicked.
